Zaoqiao or Tsaochiao township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan

sentences.english: No gulf that perfect love will not bridge.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何隔绝，完全的爱不能造桥。

sentences.english: Moved to the East China Sea Dragon King, Dragon King ordered Poseidon to help build a bridge.
sentences.chinese: 感动了东海龙王，龙王命海神帮助造桥。

sentences.english: The box which Washington had studied in Europe was used.
sentences.chinese: 造桥中使用了华盛顿在欧洲研究过的箱子。

sentences.english: They assumed that making software is like building a bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们假定开发软件就象造桥。

sentences.english: He sent reclaimed stone bridge day and night operation.
sentences.chinese: 他派人日夜运石填海造桥。

sentences.english: The Zambezi bridge, A whole boat load of us Canucks came to work on it.
sentences.chinese: 赞比西河桥，我们这些人本想来此造桥。

sentences.english: I build them to connect men's souls. God give me the right.
sentences.chinese: 我造桥连接人们的灵魂，是上帝给我的权利。

sentences.english: Wow, we cannot even build the bridge here, or the crane to assemble it.
sentences.chinese: 哇，我们甚至不会造桥了，或者造桥的吊车。

sentences.english: Wow, we cannot even build the bridge here, or the crane to assemble it.
sentences.chinese: 哇，我们甚至不会造桥了，或者造桥的吊车。

sentences.english: It was not feasible to build a bridge at that point.
sentences.chinese: 在那个地点造桥是不可行的。

sentences.english: He donated money to have roads made and bridges built so people could get around more easily.
sentences.chinese: 于是他捐钱造桥修路，方便百姓。

sentences.english: It is a milestone in the Chinese history of bridge construction and a pride of Chinese people .
sentences.chinese: 它是中国造桥史上的一座里程碑，是中国人民的骄傲。

sentences.english: The government should build a bridge when the benefits exceed the costs.
sentences.chinese: 政府在收益超过成本时应该造桥。

sentences.english: Poseidon overnight bridge more than four years.
sentences.chinese: 海神一夜之间造桥四十余里。

sentences.english: It is easier to build walls than to build bridges, isn't it?
sentences.chinese: 定立规则很容易，建墙也比造桥容易得多。

sentences.english: They will work up all these stones in building the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们将把这些石子全部用来造桥。

definition: to bridge/to put up a bridge
Mao Yisheng (1896-1989), Chinese structural engineer and social activist
to pilot a ship/to channel water/to draw water (for irrigation)
to supervise and construct/constructed under the supervision of

Zhaozhou Bridge over Xiao River 洨河[Xiao2 He2] in Zhao county 趙縣|赵县[Zhao4 Xian4], Shijiazhuang, Hebei, dating back to the Sui dynasty 隋代[Sui2 dai4] (581-617) and the world's oldest extant stone arch bridge
